##############################

In this release, the following Jira defects have been resolved on the client:

(LINK-314) A GetCurrentTime callback that rolls back (or reverses) time is not detected
(LINK-113) Anti-rollback clock seems non-functional
(LINK-36) WV_AssetPolicy with start time == 0 and end time == Long.MAX_VALUE fails on client

The secure clock has been implemented according to Netflix requirement documents.

Note that the GetCurrentTime() callout is no longer used in the license expiration 
computation.  The client OS native time function is called directly from the client 
to reduce the potential for hacking.  

GetCurrentTime() is still used for GUID calculation however, so please retain the 
implementation.

The periodic timer callout has been removed from the client API.

# [client-version]: 1.1.99  #
#                           #
#############################


(1) AssetID has been changed on client and server from uint32 to uint8[8]

(2) Added methods for encoding and decoding secure stops to a portable network-byte-order 
base64 encoded string:

-> Added to WVNetflixAPI.h:

/*
 *   WV_EncodeSecureStop
 *   Convert a binary client-byte-order secure stop structure into a cross-platform
 *   portable encoded string representation for transmission to the server.
 *
 *       [in] secureStop: A pointer to the client binary secure stop structure
 *       [out] encodedSecureStop:  The WV_EncodedSecureStop which will
 *            receive the encoded representation of the secureStop parameter
 *
 *  Returns: 
 *       WVStopStatus code indicating success or error
 */
CLIENT_API WVStopStatus
WV_EncodeSecureStop(WV_SecureStop *secureStop, WV_EncodedSecureStop encodedSecureStop);

/* 
 *   WV_DecodeSecureStop
 *   Convert a cross-platform portable encoded secure stop structure
 *   into its binary client-byte-order secure stop representation.
 *
 *     [in] encodedSecureStop:  The WV_EncodedSecureStop which contains
 *         the encoded string representation of the secure stop
 *     [out] secureStop: A pointer to the client binary secure stop structure
 *
 *  Returns: 
 *       WVStopStatus code indicating success or error
 */
CLIENT_API WVStopStatus
WV_DecodeSecureStop(WV_EncodedSecureStop encodedSecureStop, WV_SecureStop *secureStop);


(3) Added version field to secure stop structure

[LINK-107]: Remove dhParamSelect from client API

>                 Key: LINK-107
>                 URL: http://nflxpartnerpdjira.netflix.com/browse/LINK-107
>             Project: Project Link
>          Issue Type: Task
>      Security Level: Default Link Security Level(Netflix and external partners) 
>          Components: Widevine
>            Reporter: Eli Chen
>            Assignee: Jeff Tinker
>            Priority: Major
>
> Please remove the dhParamSelect parameter from client API WV_GlobalInit().  The goal is that this parameter should be a link time option instead of run time.  We do not want the potential to run different dhParamSelect options in a shipped client code.  For testing purposes, we will select different DH parameters of the client library using the Makefile to select the right library to link against.
> To be explicit, these are our requests:
> 1) Remove dhParamSelect from WV_GlobalInit() 
> 2) Provide separate client binary libraries for each DH parameter option.
> 3) Label the client binary library with the DH parameter option
> 4) In future releases, supply us versions of client binaries for all valid DH parameters.
> 5) Verify that each client binary can only be run with 1 DH parameter, and that it's not easy to change the code to change the DH parameter.

Response:

1) Complete - dhParamSelect is no longer an argument to WV_GlobalInit()
2) Complete - there are now three separate client libraries, one for each dh parameter group 0..2
3) Complete - Label the client binary library with the DH parameter option
4) Will do
5) Complete - Physically removed the unused parameter groups from each each client library, so it's not easy to run the client with an alternate group.
